newsitem.title: USA: Sept CME S&P 500 futures fall initial 15-pt limit.
newsitem.headline: Sept CME S&P 500 futures fall initial 15-pt limit.

text.p: September Standard & Poor's (S&P) 500 futures briefly fell the initial 15.0-point price limit before cutting losses.
The contract fell to a low of 922.95, pressured by weakness in Nasdaq stocks, floor brokers said.

The 15.0-point down limit is in effect for 15 minutes or until 1430 CDT/1930 GMT. Under CME rules, if lead-month futures were limit offered at the end of that 15-minute period or at 1430 CDT, trading would halt for two minutes and resume with the next down limit in effect. Before 1430 CDT, the next limit restricting price drops is down 30.0 points.
